alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 22 at 9:21PM PST until December 24 at 11:00PM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 10 inches and ice accumulations of one tenth to half an inch. * WHERE...East Slopes of the Washington Cascades. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 11 PM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Expect power outages and tree damage due to the ice. Travel could be impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1, or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com for Oregon or https://wsdot.com/travel for Washington.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Washington Cascades
